alert.note: Alert for Attala; Leake; Madison; Neshoba; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 1:24AM CDT until June 19 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Attala County in central Mississippi... Leake County in central Mississippi... Northeastern Madison County in central Mississippi... Neshoba County in east central Mississippi... Southern Winston County in east central Mississippi... * Until 430 AM CDT. * At 124 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Carthage, Pearl River, Redwater, Tucker, Standing Pine, Noxapater, Sallis, Renfroe, Singleton, Edinburg, Zama, Smyrna, Madden, Dowdville, Thomastown, Dixon, Mcadams, Newport and Burnside. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
